SEARCH
Package Repository

Class BookRepo

java.lang.Object
Repository.AbstractRepo<Book>
Repository.BookRepo
public class BookRepo extends AbstractRepo<Book>
Repository class for managing Book entities. Provides methods for performing database operations related to books.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class Repository.AbstractRepo

    entityClass, entityManager

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      public List<Book> findAll()
      Retrieves all books, including their publishers and copies, with distinct results.
      Overrides:
      findAll in class AbstractRepo<Book>
      Returns:
      a list of all books in the database.

    • findByIsbn

      public Optional<Book> findByIsbn(String isbn)
      Finds a book by its ISBN.
      Parameters:
      isbn - the ISBN of the book to find.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the book if found, or empty otherwise.

    • findByTitle

      public List<Book> findByTitle(String title)
      Finds books by their title, with a case-insensitive search.
      Parameters:
      title - the title or partial title of the books to find.
      Returns:
      a list of books matching the given title.

    • findAvailableBooks

      public List<Book> findAvailableBooks()
      Retrieves all books that have at least one available copy.
      Returns:
      a list of books with available copies.

    • findAllOrderByTitle

      public List<Book> findAllOrderByTitle()
      Retrieves all books ordered by their title.
      Returns:
      a list of books ordered alphabetically by title.

    • findBooksWithAvailableCopies

      public List<Book> findBooksWithAvailableCopies()
      Retrieves all books with at least one available copy.
      Returns:
      a list of books with available copies.

    • saveWithPublisher

      public Book saveWithPublisher(Book book)
      Saves a book along with its publisher. If the publisher is new, it is also persisted.
      Parameters:
      book - the book to save.
      Returns:
      the saved book with updated relationships.
